COER: inflorescence stalk for buds, flowers or finished flowers
GRBU: inflorescence stalk for buds, flowers or finished flowers
GRSP: inflorescence stalk for buds, flowers or finished flowers
PILI: inflorescence stalk for buds, flowers or finished flowers

COER: unstalked inflorescence bud; weight includes stalk and miniature buds; long before individual buds are discernable
HATE: tiny inflorescence bud with surrounding bracts; this stage lasts for many months

GRBU: inflorescence bud; weight includes stalk and miniature buds; stage before individual buds are discernable
GRSP: inflorescence bud; weight includes stalk and miniature buds; stage before individual buds are discernable
HATE: small inflorescence bud with surrounding bracts; stage at which inflorescence buds are just beginning to expand

COER: stalked  inflorescence bud; weight includes stalk and miniature buds; stage before individual buds are discernable
HATE: mid-sized inflorescence bud with surrounding bracts
PILI: stalked  inflorescence bud; weight includes stalk and developing bracts containing miniature buds; stage before individual buds are discernable

HATE: set of bracts from a single inflorescence; this is the stage at which the bracts are shed
all floral material within one inflorescence bud; still counted as "1 per inflorescence" NOT "1 per flower"

GRSP: inflorescence stalk in fruit

COER: fruiting stems with a single branch

LEES: buds that have aborted just after they begin to form; includes all flower parts
PEPU: buds that have aborted just after they begin to form; includes all flower parts

BAER: buds that are just starting to form; includes all flower parts
BOLE: buds that are just starting to form; all flower parts, including pedicel
EPMI: buds that are just starting to form; includes all flower parts
GRSP: buds that are just discernable; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
LEES: buds that are just starting to form; includes all flower parts
PEPU: buds that are just starting to form; includes all flower parts

BAER: small buds; includes all flower parts
BOLE: small buds; all flower parts, including pedicel
GRBU: small buds; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
GRSP: small buds; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
HEPU: small buds; includes all flower parts
PELA: small buds; includes all flower parts
PHPH: small buds; all flower parts including bract, pedicel, and calyx

BAER: mid-sized buds; includes all flower parts
BOLE: mid-sized buds; all flower parts, including pedicel
EPMI: mid-sized buds; all flower parts, including pedicel
GRBU: mid-sized buds; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
GRSP: mid-sized buds; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
LEES: mid-sized buds; includes all flower parts
PELA: mid-sized buds; includes all flower parts
PHPH: mid-sized buds; all flower parts including bract, pedicel, and calyx

BAER: large buds; includes all flower parts
BOLE: large buds; all flower parts, including pedicel
COER: large buds; all flower parts, including bract
EPMI: large buds; includes all flower parts
GRBU: large buds; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
GRSP: large buds; includes all flower parts; counted per flower
HEPU: large buds; includes all flower parts
LEES: large buds; includes all flower parts
PELA: large buds; includes all flower parts
PEPU: large buds; includes all flower parts
PILI: large buds; includes all flower parts
PUTU: large buds; includes all flower parts

BAER: buds just starting to open; includes all flower parts
GRSP: almost open flower; all floral parts; counted per flower

BAER: flower petals and stamens
COER: flower petals, collected from very late finished fruit, as this is the first point petals detach from the rest
EPMI: petals removed from finished flower because you can't separate them while in flower; just did 6 more
GRBU: petals and stamens
GRSP: petals and stamens
HATE: flower petals and stamens; units are per flower
PEPU: flower petals

BAER: entire carpel from a flower in full bloom
COER: carpel and bract from individual in full flower; since petals still firmly attached at flowering stage, weight determined by subtracting "flower_all_parts" - "flower petals"
GRBU: carpel and pedicel
GRSP: carpel and pedicel
HATE: carpel from individual in full flower; units are per flower
PELA: carpel from individual in full flower
PEPU: carpel from individual in full flower; includes "fluff"
PHPH: carpel from individual in full flower
PUTU: carpel and stamens from individual in full flower

EPMI: includes calyx, pedicel, carpel, stamensof flowers in full bloom; collected parts include petals, but their weight is subtracted off
HEPU: calyx and carpel in full flower
LEES: calyx, pedicel, carpel, stamens of flowers in full bloom
PEPU: NOT SURE IF THIS CATEGORY EXISTS AT THE MOMENT; need to weight until plants in flower
PHPH: calyx from individual in full flower
PILI: flower calyx; Collected parts include both calyx and carpel, which can't be separate because carpel too small, so subtract off weight of "flower_stigma" from collected weights
PUTU: calyx from individual in full flower

PHPH: aborted flower with petals, but much lighter than other flowers; includes all flower parts
PUTU: aborted flower with petals, but much lighter than other flowers; includes all flower parts

PHPH: aborted flower without petals; these are lighter than small buds, so not part of main progression;  includes all flower parts

BAER: style, but not ovary from a finished flower

BOLE: flower with petals that have closed after flowering; the carpels, petals, and pedicel have been removed
COER: browning flower; includes bract, ovary; weight of petals subtracted off, since petals can't be removed until later stage
EPMI: includes calyx, pedicel, carpel, stamens as petals are wilting
HEPU: calyx and carpel as petals are shedding; termed "just shed" in census sheets
LEES: calyx, pedicel, carpel, stamens as petals are shedding

BAER: carpel just after flowering
BOLE: single carpel from a finished flower (1 of a set of 4)
GRBU: carpel and pedicel after petals have been shed
GRSP: carpel and pedicel; collected after petals shed, but before it becomes swollen
PHPH: carpel dissected from flowers with browning petals
PUTU: carpel and stamens dissected from flowers with browning petals

BOLE: calyx from late finished flower with the carpels, petals, and pedicel removed
petals from flower that is enclosing developing fruits; they are bigger than petals during flowering

PHPH: pair of two bracts for flower, finished flower, or fruit
PILI: set of 4 bracts that surrounds an inflorescence
PUTU: set of brown bracts for flower, finished flower, or fruit

COER: bract from a young fruit, large immature fruit or mature fruit

HEPU: calyx from a young fruit, large immature fruit or mature fruit
LEES: calyx and pedicel from a large immature fruit or mature fruit

BOLE: pedicel from a flower or finished flower
GRBU: pedicel from a mature fruit; considered a separate part once at "fruit large immature" as this is when they start expanding
GRSP: pedicel from a mature fruit; considered a separate part once at "fruit large immature" as this is when they start expanding
PELA: pedicel in flower, finished flower or fruit

BAER: small fruit - corn kernal sized
COER: still covered by petals or petals just fallen off; includes bract (petals removed and weighed separately as "flower - petals")
GRBU: 2-3 mm fruit, measured as swollen section; includes pedicel
GRSP: 2-3 mm fruit, measured as swollen section; includes pedicel
HATE: very small fruit, still very skinny
LEES: smallest fruit category; still includes calyx
PELA: just past the "finished flower stigma" stage; still very small, with the carpel more obvious than the fruit
PEPU: very tiny fruit

BAER: mid-sized fruit
COER: green fruit; bract a separate part
EPMI: young fruit that is a brown sphere visible within the calyx; includes calyx and pedicel
GRBU: 4-6 mm fruit, measured as swollen section; includes pedicel
GRSP: 4-5 mm fruit, measured as swollen section; includes pedicel
HATE: slightly larger, but still skinny fruit
PELA: fruit that is 3-6 mm in length
PEPU: mid-sized fruit
PILI: not yet inflated white fruit; calyx weighed separately

HEPU: mid-sized fruit; calyx weighed separately; individuals tagged as aborting simply because I know they don't progress

BAER: large green fruit - nearly full sized
COER: orange fruit; bract a separate part
EPMI: stage at which the fruit is beginning to bulge out of the calyx, but is not yet hardening; includes calyx and pedicel
GRBU: fruit more than 7 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
GRSP: fruit more than 6 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
HATE: larger fruit, but not yet hardeneed
HEPU: large, but not yet dry fruit; calyx weighed separately
LEES: large, but still green fruit; calyx weighed separately
PELA: fruit that is more than 7 mm in diameter , but not yet mature; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
PEPU: large, but not yet mature fruit
PILI: nearly full size, still green fruit; calyx weighed separately

GRBU: fruit more than 7 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
GRSP: fruit more than 6 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
PELA: fruit that is more than 7 mm in diameter , but not yet mature; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses

GRBU: fruit more than 7 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
GRSP: fruit more than 6 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
PELA: fruit that is more than 7 mm in diameter , but not yet mature; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses

GRBU: fruit more than 7 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
GRSP: fruit more than 6 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
PELA: fruit that is more than 7 mm in diameter , but not yet mature; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses

GRBU: fruit more than 7 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
GRSP: fruit more than 6 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
PELA: fruit that is more than 7 mm in diameter , but not yet mature; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses

GRBU: fruit more than 7 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
GRSP: fruit more than 6 mm in length, the point at which the seeds begin to expand more; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses
PELA: fruit that is more than 7 mm in diameter , but not yet mature; a fruit can grow and stay at this "stage" for several censuses

HEPU: large, but not yet dry fruit; calyx weighed separately; tagged as aborting simply because I know they don't progress to the next stage

HATE: shriveled fruit that is shedding early
HEPU: aborted fruit, including calyx; based on weight, this has aborted quite early
LEES: brown, round, dry fruit, but much small than "mature fruit"; calyx separate
PEPU: very small fruit; don't contain a seed and the seed pod is quite small; determination based on weight
PILI: empty seed pod or seed pod with aborting fruit

PEPU: full sized fruit, but much lighter weight, because no seed (or a very small seed) inside; determined based on weight

COER: bright orange fruit; bract a separate part
EPMI: mature fruit, including calyx and pedicel (because they are fused to the fruit and therefore part of the dispersal unit)
HEPU: mature, dry fruit; set of 4 from a single flower counted as "1"
LEES: brown, round, plump, dry fruit; calyx separate; seed fused to fruit, so this is the dispersal unit
PEPU: dry, full fruit; considered "viable" (vesus aborted or empty) based on weight; for tagged plants, actual fruit removed from cone; seed fused to fruit, so this is the dispersal unit

BAER: mature seed pod, including papery layer between seeds; removed from cone
BOLE: seed pod once fruit is large and black
GRBU: seed pod once seed is mature; varies considerably by length; does not include pedicel
GRSP: seed pod once seed is mature; varies considerably by length; does not include pedicel
HATE: hardened seed pods with mature or immature seeds removed
PELA: combination of various outer fruit layers (fleshy and woody) removed from mature seed
PHPH: seed pod from around seed or aborted seed
PILI: black seed pod from around seed or aborted seed
PUTU: seed pod from around seed or aborted seed

HATE: immature seed; already large, but not yet full weight or hardened

BAER: aborted, flat seeds; for tagged plants, removed and weighed actual seeds from cones
GRBU: seeds that are quite flat and much lighter than others of similar length
GRSP: seeds that are quite flat and much lighter than others of similar length
HATE: aborted seeds removed from pods; considered "aborted" by weight
PHPH: flat, lightweight seed; seeds determined "aborted" either visually or by weight
PUTU: flat, lightweight seed; seeds determined "aborted" either visually or by weight

BAER: fully mature seeds; for tagged plants, removed and weighed actual seeds from cones
GRBU: mature seeds weighed from pod; all mature seeds similar weight regardless of pod length
GRSP: mature seeds weighed from pod; all mature seeds similar weight regardless of pod length
HATE: mature seeds removed from pods; considered "viable" based on weight
PELA: seed with fleshy and woody layers removed; since seed size variable with fruit size, use regression equation to calculate seed weight
PHPH: round, healthy seed; seeds determined "viable" by weight
PUTU: round, healthy seed; seeds determined "viable" by weight

PEPU: very young cone; just a mound of "cone" starting to form
very young cone; just a mound of "cone" starting to form

BAER: young cone that is still quite skinny and mostly lengthening, although some increase in width as well; base included in length at this stage
PEPU: young cone that is in the process of lengthening; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is still quite skinny and mostly lengthening, although some increase in width as well; base included in length at this stage
PEPU: young cone that is in the process of lengthening; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is still quite skinny and mostly lengthening, although some increase in width as well; base included in length at this stage
PEPU: young cone that is in the process of lengthening; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is still quite skinny and mostly lengthening, although some increase in width as well; base included in length at this stage
PEPU: young cone that is in the process of lengthening; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is no beginning to widen, as well as lengthen; usually at "tiny_bud" stage, but on some robust plants, reach this stage before buds begin expanding; can stay at this stage through several size transitions; base weighed separately at this stage
PEPU: green cone with large buds or in flower; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is no beginning to widen, as well as lengthen; usually at "tiny_bud" stage, but on some robust plants, reach this stage before buds begin expanding; can stay at this stage through several size transitions; base weighed separately at this stage
PEPU: green cone with large buds or in flower; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is no beginning to widen, as well as lengthen; usually at "tiny_bud" stage, but on some robust plants, reach this stage before buds begin expanding; can stay at this stage through several size transitions; base weighed separately at this stage
PEPU: green cone with large buds or in flower; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: young cone that is no beginning to widen, as well as lengthen; usually at "tiny_bud" stage, but on some robust plants, reach this stage before buds begin expanding; can stay at this stage through several size transitions; base weighed separately at this stage
PEPU: green cone with large buds or in flower; can stay at this stage through several size transitions

BAER: mature, dry cone where no follicles matured; quite skinny and floppy compared to "cone_brown"
mature, dry cone containing at least some mature follicles
PEPU: mature, dry cone containing at least come "mature" fruit, although all the fruit might be empty or aborted

BAER: cone that has aborted long before flowering; usually transitions to this from a small-sized "cone_green"
PEPU: cone that has aborted either before flowering or at the start of flowering

BAER: base of a growing cone; woody section that elevates cone above branch and has no flowers
base of a growing cone; woody section that elevates cone above branch and has no flowers
base of a growing cone; woody section that elevates cone above branch and has no flowers
base of a growing cone; woody section that elevates cone above branch and has no flowers
base of a mature cone; woody section that elevates cone above branch and has no flowers
